Day 1 launch on here was kind of a disaster for me. I had bought the invasion bundle for 14.99 through the Steam launcher and did not receive my items. I even debated on buying from b.net before I ultimately decided to purchase through Steam. Go figures Blizzard wasn't prepared for this type of problem...and it is not just me having this problem either. The review page on the bundles tab is full of reviews from other people who didn't get what they paid for. I can't just blame Blizzard though, Steam is also responsible for this mishap.

Êö¥Èõ™ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÂØπ‰Ω†‰ª¨ÂëòÂ∑•ÁöÑÂº∫Â•∏ÂíåÊÄßÈ™öÊâ∞Ôºå‰Ω†‰ª¨ÊòØ‰∏≠ÂÖ±ÁöÑÊ∑∑ËõãÔºå‰Ω†‰ª¨Ê∞∏ËøúÊòØÁ≥üÁ≥ïÁöÑÊ∏∏ÊàèÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÔºå‰Ω†‰ª¨‰ºöÁæûÊ≠ªÁöÑ
Same game, new price, still trash. =)

Even ignoring all the glaring problems Blizzard as a company has, Overwatch 2 is an unfocused mess of content, with a terrible battle pass that somehow makes loot boxes look like a better alternative. The developers can't seem to do anything right, and can't even properly release a campaign that's been in the works for four years.

And honestly, it's really not even that fun.

The game is quite fun, I also don't like the direction Overwatch 2 took, but the game is a lot of fun to play.

It's not any more of a cash grab than most recent games, I can understand people being angry about the game becoming worse, but if you're looking to try the game for the first time, you'll feel like it's mostly in line with other popular games, there's a battlepass, you need to play to unlock characters, skins are mostly paid and there's hardly any way to unlock them without spending some money, yknow, just like league, valorant, apex, etc.

I love this game. Ive put thousands of hours into Overwatch since I started playing in 2017 and Ive experienced every rank from Bronze to Top500, but Overwatch 2 doesnt feel like Overwatch. Blizzard has made too many mistakes in the recent years and its completely killed off my excitement for the game. Transitioning to 5v5, cancellation of the PVE, the terrible shop prices, and the locking of heroes behind battle-pass levels are just a few mistakes off the top of my head. The only things I can think of to fix Overwatch 2 would be bringing back 6v6, improving the battle-pass, fixing shop prices, and completing the PVE. I know none of these things will happen due to the insane amounts of money they're making but OW2 isnt the game I fell in love with. If I had to summarize the current state of the game it would be "Stockholm Syndrome." Pretty please Blizzard, fix your game.

-JeffyJA
